results.address: 6645 Humboldt Ave N, Minneapolis, Minnesota, 55430
results.raw: 40 Arrested After Protesters and Police Clashed in Brooklyn Center at 6645 Humboldt Ave N, Minneapolis, Minnesota, 55430
results.rawLocation: 6645 Humboldt Ave N, Minneapolis, Minnesota, 55430
results.title: 40 Arrested After Protesters and Police Clashed in Brooklyn Center

-MY7iiq7P9kQGQFBDuG0.text: Incident reported at 6645 Humboldt Ave N.

-MY7ij3KDd6l4JJxs0Cq.text: Police are monitoring several hundred protesters demonstrating outside of the Brooklyn Center Police Department.

-MY7itdmgyXPtIIMdJWP.text: National Guard personnel report the protesters have begun throwing hazardous objects.

-MY7iy59bsmFviUt6UEm.text: According to National Guard units at the scene, several officers are preparing to deploy smoke bombs in an effort to disperse the crowd.

-MY7q9VDQPREtv051h29.text: Units on scene report the protesters may also be weaponizing lasers.

-MY7qEvf-sAullx9osZI.text: Additional sources at the scene advise police may be armed with rubber bullets or PepperBalls. Police have also begun deploying smoke bombs.

-MY7tG0iyt5lBKi1JOfv.text: Video footage from local sources shows police using what appear to be stun grenades to disperse the crowd.

-MY7xIrJ_WzGyRjxnQPp.text: National Guard personnel report the protesters have begun weaponizing bricks, glass bottles, and lasers. Police have begun deploying CS grenades and other less-lethal weaponry to disperse the crowd.

-MY7ygXUirNKyKB-gihC.text: According to an update provided by Minnesota's Operation Safety Net via Twitter, law enforcement personnel have begun arresting members of the crowd for violating curfew and dispersal orders.

-MY80wxgdSuIcgNQR7Yi.text: According to additional sources from the scene, Minnesota State Police are expanding their perimeter and mobilizing towards protesters.

-MY83t3IgbWX2lMK84dg.text: A previous update stated that multiple people have been injured; however, it is unclear if there are any who have sustained injuries.

-MY85QlBOPIYoHmKShKm.text: According to video sources on scene, multiple stores have been looted. Police appear to be dispersing crowds away from the businesses.

-MY85tXMcOC3hBKg_cYx.text: According to Minnesota State Police a nearby Dollar Tree may be on fire.

-MY87WC5ZHoeSyQefA7D.text: According to additional sources, Minnesota State Police have formed a perimeter around the shopping center on 6800 North Humboldt Avenue.

-MY88C5ao1TzUhhOi3q4.text: Firefighters have been notified of the fire at the Dollar Tree on 6800 North Humboldt Avenue.

-MY89-FTe8T5x3sdjn5C.text: Video sources from the scene show police detaining protesters as they expand their perimeter.

-MY8AZcR4HMB7E8W-d5H.text: According to third-party video, Minnesota State Police have extended their perimeter to the Clark Pump N Munch on 69th Avenue North & North Humboldt Avenue.

-MY8BFkGkjbAWt8n1CUP.text: National Guard personnel report 24 people have been arrested.

-MY8KtuDQ7emBfAWtMWB.text: According to additional sources, Minnesota State Police have expanded their perimeter to Community Corner on 1500 69th Avenue North.

-MY8M3zUsqAtIERse-FI.text: Third-party video sources report Minnesota State Police are mobilizing east on 69th Avenue North. People are throwing rocks and explosions can be heard.

-MY8NHncnvCEZE4AskPX.text: Additional sources at the scene advise state police units are clearing out occupied vehicles that are within their perimeter. A blockade of police personnel and armored vehicles are occupying 69th Avenue North between Fremont Place North and North Humboldt Avenue.

-MY8PRf-yXW46AkA3uau.text: Video footage from local sources show the majority of protesters leaving the area. There is still a large media presence on scene.

-MY8jF5kTwUeYNAZRF3Q.text: According to Col. Matt Langer of the Minnesota State Patrol, approximately 40 arrests have been made at Brooklyn Center. Multiple officers were struck by unspecified objects and have sustained minor injuries.

nib.text:
Demonstrators gathered outside of the Brooklyn Center Police Department Monday night, one day after Daunte Wright was shot and killed by police during a traffic stop.

A 7 p.m. curfew went into effect in Hennepin County and the surrounding counties of Anoka, Dakota, and Ramsey.

Hundreds of people remained after curfew outside of the police building, which was fenced off, despite multiple dispersal orders from law enforcement. 

Video from local media and those in the crowd showed law enforcement deploying tear gas and flash-bang canisters.

Officers warned that curfew violations would result in misdemeanor charges for anyone arrested.

In a midnight press conference, officials said that police made about 40 arrests ranging from curfew violation to riotous behavior. 

According to officials, a several officers suffered minor injuries due to thrown debris. 

Officials said that they were unaware of any injuries to protesters Monday night. 

Minneapolis Police officials said that five businesses in Minneapolis were burglarized, including a liquor store, a Target Express, a tobacco store, an AutoZone and a shoe store.

results.address: Minneapolis-St Paul Int'l Airport
results.raw: Hennepin, Ramsey, Anoka, and Dakota Counties Curfew Lifted by Governor Walz at Minneapolis-St Paul Int'l Airport
results.rawLocation: Minneapolis-St Paul Int'l Airport
results.title: Hennepin, Ramsey, Anoka, and Dakota Counties Curfew Lifted by Governor Walz

-MY6_ZDc4yx4NvUL3z4n.text: Incident reported at Minneapolis-St Paul Int'l Airport.

-MY6_ZKSBV2OGuEEdtxg.text: Governor Walz announced that Hennepin, Ramsey, and Anoka counties will be under a curfew from 7 p.m. Monday until 6 a.m. Tuesday.

-MY7TqWIvBAURQ0uU5vy.text: Dakota County officials said they will observe the regional curfew as well.

nib.text:
UPDATE: Tuesday afternoon, Governor Walz lifted the state-imposed curfew in Hennepin, Ramsey, Dakota and Anoka counties. Local jurisdictions are still able to impose a curfew of their own.

Residents of Hennepin, Ramsey, Dakota, and Anoka counties were under curfew starting 7 p.m. Monday night until 6 a.m. Tuesday morning. 

State and local officials announced there would be exemptions for credentialed press, law enforcement, emergency responders, those traveling to and from work, and community patrols.

Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey noted the curfews are in response to the police shooting of Daunte Wright in Brooklyn Center. “This anguish that we’re all suffering cannot translate into violence … We must see peace tonight,” Mayor Frey said in the Monday afternoon briefing.

Major General Shawn Manke of the MN National Guard added that Guard deployments would expand from 500 personnel as of Monday morning to over 1,000 by the end of the day in order to support Phase 3 of Operation Safety Net. He said they would be deployed throughout Minneapolis, St. Paul, and Brooklyn Center.

Additional personnel will be placed in staging areas until they are assigned specific missions and shift rotations based on needs and conditions on the ground.

Manke dispelled rumors that the guard has used nonlethal munitions in and around Minneapolis-St Paul.

“We are committed to meeting the intent of Operation Safety Net, to protect the communities and the people while preserving their constitutional rights and the peaceful expression of First Amendment Rights,” he said.
